string-array.name: crypt
string-array.item: In the basement of the Alexander Nevsky Cathedral there is a Crypt where arranged in chronology are about 300 exhibits, mostly icons, and mural fragments and prints. The exhibits date from the 9th century AD until the end of the 19th century. The collection is the most representative one, revealing the development of iconography in the Bulgarian lands.
Working Hours: \n10 am to 6 pm; Closed: Monday;
1 St. Alexander Nevski Square, Sofia 1000 (Click to see on the map)
